rules.description: Detects potential Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities from unescaped user input in HTML output
rules.recommendation: Use HTML escaping functions (e.g., html.escape() in Python, textContent in JavaScript, htmlspecialchars() in PHP) or template engines with auto-escaping enabled. For static HTML, use string literals.
rules.message: User input rendered as HTML without escaping can lead to XSS attacks. Static HTML templates are allowed.
